@description.body:

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Basic event object.

Please note:
Event objects are only valid during the event dispatch. After the dispatch
event objects are pooled or disposed. If you want to safe a reference to an
event instance use the {@link #clone} method.

The interface is modeled after the DOM level 2 event interface:
http://www.w3.org/TR/DOM-Level-2-Events/events.html#Events-interface

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The current event phase is the capturing phase.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The event is currently being evaluated at the target

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The current event phase is the bubbling phase.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: {qx.Promise[]} promises returned by event handlers

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Initialize the fields of the event. The event must be initialized before
it can be dispatched.

@param.name: @param
@param
@param.body:
cancelable {Boolean?false} Whether or not an event can have its default
action prevented. The default action can either be the browser's
default action of a native event (e.g. open the context menu on a
right click) or the default action of a qooxdoo class (e.g. close
the window widget). The default action can be prevented by calling
{@link #preventDefault}
@param.description:
Whether or not an event can have its default
action prevented. The default action can either be the browser's
default action of a native event (e.g. open the context menu on a
right click) or the default action of a qooxdoo class (e.g. close
the window widget). The default action can be prevented by calling
{@link #preventDefault}

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {qx.event.type.Event} The initialized event instance
@return.description: The initialized event instance

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Create a clone of the event object, which is not automatically disposed
or pooled after an event dispatch.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: embryo {qx.event.type.Event?null} Optional event class, which will be configured using the data of this event instance. The event must be an instance of this event class. If the value is null, a new pooled instance is created.
@param.description: Optional event class, which will be configured using the data of this event instance. The event must be an instance of this event class. If the value is null, a new pooled instance is created.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {qx.event.type.Event} a clone of this class.
@return.description: a clone of this class.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Stops event from all further processing. Execute this when the
current handler should have "exclusive rights" to the event
and no further reaction by anyone else should happen.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
This method is used to prevent further propagation of an event during event
flow. If this method is called by any event listener the event will cease
propagating through the tree. The event will complete dispatch to all listeners
on the current event target before event flow stops.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Get whether further event propagation has been stopped.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} Whether further propagation has been stopped.
@return.description: Whether further propagation has been stopped.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Prevent the default action of cancelable events, e.g. opening the context
menu, ...

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Adds a promise to the list of promises returned by event handlers

@param.name: @param
@param.body: promise {qx.Promise} the promise to add
@param.description: the promise to add

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the array of promises, or null if there are no promises

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {qx.Promise[]?}

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Returns a promise for this event; if the event is defaultPrevented, the promise
is a rejected promise, otherwise it is fulfilled.  The promise returned will only
be fulfilled when the promises added via {@link addPromise} are also fulfilled

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Get whether the default action has been prevented

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} Whether the default action has been prevented
@return.description: Whether the default action has been prevented

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The name of the event

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {String} name of the event
@return.description: name of the event

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Override the event type

@param.name: @param
@param.body: type {String} new event type
@param.description: new event type

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Used to indicate which phase of event flow is currently being evaluated.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{Integer} The current event phase. Possible values are
{@link #CAPTURING_PHASE}, {@link #AT_TARGET} and {@link #BUBBLING_PHASE}.
@return.description:
The current event phase. Possible values are
{@link #CAPTURING_PHASE}, {@link #AT_TARGET} and {@link #BUBBLING_PHASE}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Override the event phase

@param.name: @param
@param.body: eventPhase {Integer} new event phase
@param.description: new event phase

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The time (in milliseconds relative to the epoch) at which the event was created.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Integer} the timestamp the event was created.
@return.description: the timestamp the event was created.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Returns the event target to which the event was originally
dispatched.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{Element} target to which the event was originally
dispatched.
@return.description:
target to which the event was originally
dispatched.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Override event target.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: target {Element} new event target
@param.description: new event target

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Get the event target node whose event listeners are currently being
processed. This is particularly useful during event capturing and
bubbling.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{Element} The target the event listener is currently
dispatched on.
@return.description:
The target the event listener is currently
dispatched on.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Override current target.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: currentTarget {Element} new current target
@param.description: new current target

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Get the related event target. This is only configured for
events which also had an influences on another element e.g.
mouseover/mouseout, focus/blur, ...

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Element} The related target
@return.description: The related target

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Override related target.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: relatedTarget {Element} new related target
@param.description: new related target

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Get the original event target. This is only configured
for events which are fired by another event (often when
the target should be reconfigured for another view) e.g.
low-level DOM event to widget event.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Element} The original target
@return.description: The original target

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Override original target.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: originalTarget {Element} new original target
@param.description: new original target

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Check whether or not the event is a bubbling event. If the event can
bubble the value is true, else the value is false.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} Whether the event bubbles
@return.description: Whether the event bubbles

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Set whether the event bubbles.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: bubbles {Boolean} Whether the event bubbles
@param.description: Whether the event bubbles

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Get whether the event is cancelable

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} Whether the event is cancelable
@return.description: Whether the event is cancelable

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Set whether the event is cancelable

@param.name: @param
@param.body: cancelable {Boolean} Whether the event is cancelable
@param.description: Whether the event is cancelable

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
The bind method delegates the call to the
{@link qx.data.SingleValueBinding#bind} function. As source, the current
object (this) will be used.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
sourcePropertyChain {String} The property chain which represents
the source property.
@param.description:
The property chain which represents
the source property.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
targetObject {qx.core.Object} The object which the source should
be bind to.
@param.description:
The object which the source should
be bind to.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: targetProperty {String} The property name of the target object.
@param.description: The property name of the target object.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
options {Map?null} A map containing the options. See
{@link qx.data.SingleValueBinding#bind} for more
information.
@param.description:
A map containing the options. See
{@link qx.data.SingleValueBinding#bind} for more
information.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{var} Returns the internal id for that binding. This can be used
for referencing the binding e.g. for removing. This is not an atomic
id so you can't you use it as a hash-map index.
@return.description:
Returns the internal id for that binding. This can be used
for referencing the binding e.g. for removing. This is not an atomic
id so you can't you use it as a hash-map index.

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body:
{qx.core.AssertionError} If the event is no data event or
there is no property definition for object and property (source and
target).
@throws.description:
If the event is no data event or
there is no property definition for object and property (source and
target).

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
The bind method delegates the call to the
{@link qx.data.SingleValueBinding#bind} function. As source, the current
object (this) will be used.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
sourcePropertyChain {String} The property chain which represents
the source property.
@param.description:
The property chain which represents
the source property.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
targetObject {qx.core.Object} The object which the source should
be bind to.
@param.description:
The object which the source should
be bind to.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: targetProperty {String} The property name of the target object.
@param.description: The property name of the target object.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
options {Map} A map containing the options. See
{@link qx.data.SingleValueBinding#bind} for more
information.
@param.description:
A map containing the options. See
{@link qx.data.SingleValueBinding#bind} for more
information.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{qx.Promise} A promise which is resolved when the initial value
has been set on the target.  Note that this does NOT resolve when subsequent
values are returned.  The promise value is the internal id for that binding.
The id can be used for referencing the binding e.g. for removing. This is not
an atomic id so you can't you use it as a hash-map index.
@return.description:
A promise which is resolved when the initial value
has been set on the target.  Note that this does NOT resolve when subsequent
values are returned.  The promise value is the internal id for that binding.
The id can be used for referencing the binding e.g. for removing. This is not
an atomic id so you can't you use it as a hash-map index.

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body:
{qx.core.AssertionError} If the event is no data event or
there is no property definition for object and property (source and
target).
@throws.description:
If the event is no data event or
there is no property definition for object and property (source and
target).

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Removes the binding with the given id from the current object. The
id has to be the id returned by any of the bind functions.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: id {var} The id of the binding.
@param.description: The id of the binding.

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body: {Error} If the binding could not be found.
@throws.description: If the binding could not be found.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Removes all bindings between the object and the related one.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
relatedObject {qx.core.Object} The object of which related
bindings should be removed.
@param.description:
The object of which related
bindings should be removed.

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body:
{Error} If one of the bindings listed internally can not be
removed.
@throws.description:
If one of the bindings listed internally can not be
removed.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns an array which lists all bindings for the object.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{Array} An array of binding informations. Every binding
information is an array itself containing id, sourceObject, sourceEvent,
targetObject and targetProperty in that order.
@return.description:
An array of binding informations. Every binding
information is an array itself containing id, sourceObject, sourceEvent,
targetObject and targetProperty in that order.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Logs a debug message.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
varargs {var} The item(s) to log. Any number of arguments is
supported. If an argument is not a string, the object dump will be
logged.
@param.description:
The item(s) to log. Any number of arguments is
supported. If an argument is not a string, the object dump will be
logged.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Logs an info message.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
varargs {var} The item(s) to log. Any number of arguments is
supported. If an argument is not a string, the object dump will be
logged.
@param.description:
The item(s) to log. Any number of arguments is
supported. If an argument is not a string, the object dump will be
logged.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Logs a warning message.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
varargs {var} The item(s) to log. Any number of arguments is
supported. If an argument is not a string, the object dump will be
logged.
@param.description:
The item(s) to log. Any number of arguments is
supported. If an argument is not a string, the object dump will be
logged.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Logs an error message.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
varargs {var} The item(s) to log. Any number of arguments is
supported. If an argument is not a string, the object dump will be
logged.
@param.description:
The item(s) to log. Any number of arguments is
supported. If an argument is not a string, the object dump will be
logged.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Logs an error message with the current stack trace

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
varargs {var} The item(s) to log. Any number of arguments is
supported. If an argument is not a string, the object dump will be
logged.
@param.description:
The item(s) to log. Any number of arguments is
supported. If an argument is not a string, the object dump will be
logged.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Helper that calls the appropriate logger function with the current object
and any number of items.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: level {String} The log level of the message
@param.description: The log level of the message

@param.name: @param
@param.body: varargs {arguments} Arguments list to be logged
@param.description: Arguments list to be logged

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Add event listener to this object.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: type {String} name of the event type
@param.description: name of the event type

@param.name: @param
@param.body: listener {Function} event callback function
@param.description: event callback function

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
self {Object ? null} Reference to the 'this' variable inside
the event listener. When not given, the corresponding dispatcher
usually falls back to a default, which is the target
by convention. Note this is not a strict requirement, i.e.
custom dispatchers can follow a different strategy.
@param.description:
Reference to the 'this' variable inside
the event listener. When not given, the corresponding dispatcher
usually falls back to a default, which is the target
by convention. Note this is not a strict requirement, i.e.
custom dispatchers can follow a different strategy.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
capture {Boolean ? false} Whether to attach the event to the
capturing phase or the bubbling phase of the event. The default is
to attach the event handler to the bubbling phase.
@param.description:
Whether to attach the event to the
capturing phase or the bubbling phase of the event. The default is
to attach the event handler to the bubbling phase.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{String} An opaque id, which can be used to remove the event listener
using the {@link #removeListenerById} method.
@return.description:
An opaque id, which can be used to remove the event listener
using the {@link #removeListenerById} method.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Add event listener to this object, which is only called once. After the
listener is called the event listener gets removed.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: type {String} name of the event type
@param.description: name of the event type

@param.name: @param
@param.body: listener {Function} event callback function
@param.description: event callback function

@param.name: @param
@param.body: context {Object ? window} reference to the 'this' variable inside the callback
@param.description: reference to the 'this' variable inside the callback

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
capture {Boolean ? false} Whether to attach the event to the
capturing phase or the bubbling phase of the event. The default is
to attach the event handler to the bubbling phase.
@param.description:
Whether to attach the event to the
capturing phase or the bubbling phase of the event. The default is
to attach the event handler to the bubbling phase.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{String} An opaque id, which can be used to remove the event listener
using the {@link #removeListenerById} method.
@return.description:
An opaque id, which can be used to remove the event listener
using the {@link #removeListenerById} method.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Remove event listener from this object

@param.name: @param
@param.body: type {String} name of the event type
@param.description: name of the event type

@param.name: @param
@param.body: listener {Function} event callback function
@param.description: event callback function

@param.name: @param
@param.body: self {Object ? null} reference to the 'this' variable inside the callback
@param.description: reference to the 'this' variable inside the callback

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
capture {Boolean} Whether to remove the event listener of
the bubbling or of the capturing phase.
@param.description:
Whether to remove the event listener of
the bubbling or of the capturing phase.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} Whether the event was removed successfully (has existed)
@return.description: Whether the event was removed successfully (has existed)

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Removes an event listener from an event target by an id returned by
{@link #addListener}

@param.name: @param
@param.body: id {String} The id returned by {@link #addListener}
@param.description: The id returned by {@link #addListener}

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} Whether the event was removed successfully (has existed)
@return.description: Whether the event was removed successfully (has existed)

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Check if there are one or more listeners for an event type.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: type {String} name of the event type
@param.description: name of the event type

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
capture {Boolean ? false} Whether to check for listeners of
the bubbling or of the capturing phase.
@param.description:
Whether to check for listeners of
the bubbling or of the capturing phase.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} Whether the object has a listener of the given type.
@return.description: Whether the object has a listener of the given type.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Dispatch an event on this object

@param.name: @param
@param.body: evt {qx.event.type.Event} event to dispatch
@param.description: event to dispatch

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{Boolean} Whether the event default was prevented or not.
Returns true, when the event was NOT prevented.
@return.description:
Whether the event default was prevented or not.
Returns true, when the event was NOT prevented.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Creates and dispatches an event on this object.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: type {String} Event type to fire
@param.description: Event type to fire

@param.name: @param
@param.body: clazz {Class?qx.event.type.Event} The event class
@param.description: The event class

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
args {Array?null} Arguments, which will be passed to
the event's init method.
@param.description:
Arguments, which will be passed to
the event's init method.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{Boolean} Whether the event default was prevented or not.
Returns true, when the event was NOT prevented.
@return.description:
Whether the event default was prevented or not.
Returns true, when the event was NOT prevented.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Create an event object and dispatch it on this object.
The event dispatched with this method does never bubble! Use only if you
are sure that bubbling is not required.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: type {String} Event type to fire
@param.description: Event type to fire

@param.name: @param
@param.body: clazz {Class?qx.event.type.Event} The event class
@param.description: The event class

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
args {Array?null} Arguments, which will be passed to
the event's init method.
@param.description:
Arguments, which will be passed to
the event's init method.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{Boolean} Whether the event default was prevented or not.
Returns true, when the event was NOT prevented.
@return.description:
Whether the event default was prevented or not.
Returns true, when the event was NOT prevented.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Creates and dispatches an non-bubbling data event on this object.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: type {String} Event type to fire
@param.description: Event type to fire

@param.name: @param
@param.body: data {var} User defined data attached to the event object
@param.description: User defined data attached to the event object

@param.name: @param
@param.body: oldData {var?null} The event's old data (optional)
@param.description: The event's old data (optional)

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
cancelable {Boolean?false} Whether or not an event can have its default
action prevented. The default action can either be the browser's
default action of a native event (e.g. open the context menu on a
right click) or the default action of a qooxdoo class (e.g. close
the window widget). The default action can be prevented by calling
{@link qx.event.type.Event#preventDefault}
@param.description:
Whether or not an event can have its default
action prevented. The default action can either be the browser's
default action of a native event (e.g. open the context menu on a
right click) or the default action of a qooxdoo class (e.g. close
the window widget). The default action can be prevented by calling
{@link qx.event.type.Event#preventDefault}

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{Boolean} Whether the event default was prevented or not.
Returns true, when the event was NOT prevented.
@return.description:
Whether the event default was prevented or not.
Returns true, when the event was NOT prevented.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Sets multiple properties at once by using a property list or
sets one property and its value by the first and second argument.
As a fallback, if no generated property setter could be found, a
handwritten setter will be searched and invoked if available.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: data {Map | String} a map of property values. The key is the name of the property.
@param.description: a map of property values. The key is the name of the property.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: value {var?} the value, only used when data is a string.
@param.description: the value, only used when data is a string.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Object} Returns this instance if data is a map or a non-generated setter is called; otherwise returns value.
@return.description: Returns this instance if data is a map or a non-generated setter is called; otherwise returns value.

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body: {Error} if a property defined does not exist
@throws.description: if a property defined does not exist

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Returns the value of the given property. If no generated getter could be
found, a fallback tries to access a handwritten getter.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: prop {String} Name of the property.
@param.description: Name of the property.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {var} The value of the value
@return.description: The value of the value

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body: {Error} if a property defined does not exist
@throws.description: if a property defined does not exist

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Resets the value of the given property. If no generated resetter could be
found, a handwritten resetter will be invoked, if available.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: prop {String} Name of the property.
@param.description: Name of the property.

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body: {Error} if a property defined does not exist
@throws.description: if a property defined does not exist

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Checks if the property is initialized, i.e. has a defined init value or
has got a value by a setter method.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: prop {String} Name of the property
@param.description: Name of the property

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} If the property is initialized
@return.description: If the property is initialized

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body: {Error} If the property defined does not exist
@throws.description: If the property defined does not exist

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the object with the specified ID

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
id
{String} ID of the object
@param.description: ID of the object

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {qx.core.Object?} the found object
@return.description: the found object

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Creates the object and adds it to a list; most classes are expected to
override `_createObjectImpl` NOT this method.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: id {String} ID of the object
@param.description: ID of the object

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {qx.core.Object?} the created object
@return.description: the created object

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Creates the object, intended to be overridden. Null is a valid return
value and will be cached by `getObject`, however `undefined` is NOT a
valid value and so will not be cached meaning that `_createObjectImpl`
will be called multiple times until a valid value is returned.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: id {String} ID of the object
@param.description: ID of the object

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {qx.core.Object?} the created object
@return.description: the created object

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Adds an object as owned by this object

@param.name: @param
@param.body: obj {qx.core.Object} the object to register
@param.description: the object to register

@param.name: @param
@param.body: id {String?} the id to set when registering the object
@param.description: the id to set when registering the object

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Discards an object from the list of owned objects; note that this does
not dispose of the object, simply forgets it if it exists.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: args {String|Object} the ID of the object to discard, or the object itself
@param.description: the ID of the object to discard, or the object itself

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Returns an array of objects that are owned by this object, or an empty
array if none exists.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Array}

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets the (computed) value of the property owner. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #owner}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the user value of the property owner. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #owner}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Resets the user value of the property owner. The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depending on the property configuration and value availability. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #owner}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets the (computed) value of the property objectId. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #objectId}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the user value of the property objectId. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #objectId}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Resets the user value of the property objectId. The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depending on the property configuration and value availability. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #objectId}.
